byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By JASON HOROWITZ and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Former Pres George W Bush raises questions about Obama administration's offer to lift sanctions on Iran as part of negotiations over its nuclear program, speaking at closed-door Republican Jewish Coalition spring meeting; also gives his views on other issues, such as candidacy of Hillary Rodham Clinton and foreign policy, as well as challenges facing his brother Jeb as he seeks presidency.
lead_paragraph: The former president, in an expansive mood while meeting with Republican Jewish donors, weighed in gingerly on foreign policy, the 2016 presidential field, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, and his own record.

headline.main: In Rare Remarks, George W. Bush Argues Against the Lifting of Iran Sanctions
headline.print_headline: In Rare Remarks, George W. Bush Argues Against the Lifting of Iran Sanctions

snippet: The former president, in an expansive mood while meeting with Republican Jewish donors, weighed in gingerly on foreign policy, the 2016 presidential field, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, and his own record.
